page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content: The building material used in the past in this area was mud and stud, i.e., mud plastered onto a timber frame with upright palings fixed between the main timbers. None of the present houses show this building method externally, though some of the early cottages in{West Torrington} probably were made in this way, but they are now faced with local brick, and have pantile, not thatched roofs. Later houses, including some larger farm houses, are made of local brick, but have had slate roofs added, while later nineteenth and early twentieth century houses are made of non-local brick with Welsh slate roofs. Later twentieth century are made of non- local materials,including the pantiles which are now re-appearing on new houses.
